document.docTitle: Turanena demirsoyi Gümüş & Neubert 2012, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: New taxa of terrestrial molluscs from Turkey (Gastropoda, Pristilomatidae, Enidae, Hygromiidae, Helicidae)

Turanena demirsoyi sp. n., holotype NMBE 32704, Erzincan, Kemaliye, Dilli Deresi, 870 m alt., leg. B. A. Guemues, H = 12.15 mm 10 Turanenea cochlicopoides, Paratype SMF 309776, Vil. subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype NMBE 32704; paratypes NMBE 32705/3; Vil. Erzincan, Kemaliye, Dilli Deresi, 39.315°N , 38.44°E , 870 m alt.,10.7.2005, leg. B. A. Guemues . - Additional paratypes: SMF 312403/1, Erzincan, Kemaliye, 2.8.1987, leg. N. Kazanci , ex Slg. Neubert; Kemaliye, Yesilyamac ( Geso ) Pass, 39.271°N , 38.567°E , 1680 m alt., 07.05.2007, leg. B. A. Guemues , NMBE 32706/2; Kemaliye, Subatan, 39.188°N , 38.406°E , 1885 m alt., 06.05.2007, leg. B. A. Guemues , NMBE 32707/1, NMBE 32708/4 (preserved); Vil. Erzincan, Kemaliye, Musaga village (= Kocacimen ), 39.296°N , 38.54°E , 1375 m alt., 13.07.2005, leg. B. A. Guemues , NMBE 32715/2.

A large species of
Turanena
with a brown shell; surface of last two whorls with whitish patchy colour pattern; teleoconch sculpture of more or less distinctive riblets.

Protoconch of almost 2 whorls, smooth, dome-shaped; shell colour pale brown, with a whitish patchy colour pattern on the last two whorls; shell of conical shape with an acutely ovate aperture; whorls of the teleoconch slightly rounded, increasing regularly, the whitish suture of medium depth; last whorl broadened, occupying nearly half of the height of the shell; surface of the teleoconch sculptured by more or less distinctive riblets; aperture rounded at the base with a faint white lip, light brown to dirty whitish deeper in the aperture; columellar rim of the aperture slightly reflected, a thin parietal callus connecting the apertural rims; periomphalum wide, umbilicus open, elongate, of medium width.
This species is dedicated to Prof. Dr. Ali Demirsoy from the Hacettepe University in Ankara to acknowledge his outstanding contributions to Turkish zoology and support for young scientists.

This species differs from most other
Turanena
species by its relatively large size;
Turanena tuccari
(Gittenberger, 1986) differs by its reinforced and reflected lip, which is always sharp and simple in the new species.
Turanena andronakii
(Lindholm, 1913) from the Coruh valley and its tributaries has a more elongate slender and always completely brown shell.
This species is only known from the surroundings of Kemaliye, its area of occupancy (AOO) is around 70km2.
